extends java.lang.Object
    The Cricket Audio interface.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(Context context)
        Initializes Cricket Audio.
        Parameters:
        context - The context that will be playing sounds

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
                        Config config)
        Initializes Cricket Audio.
        Parameters:
        context - The context that will be playing sounds
        config - Configuration info (can be null)

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Shuts down Cricket Audio.

      • update

        public static void update()
        Updates Cricket Audio. Should be called once per frame.

      • suspend

        public static void suspend()
        Suspends Cricket Audio. Typically used when an app is made inactive.

      • resume

        public static void resume()
        Resumes Cricket Audio. Typically used when an app is made active after having been inactive.

      • getRenderLoad

        public static float getRenderLoad()
        Returns an estimate of the load on the audio processing thread. This is the fraction of the interval between audio callbacks that was actually spent rendering audio; it will range between 0 and 1.

      • getClipFlag

        public static boolean getClipFlag()
        Returns the value of the clip flag. The clip flag is set to true whenever the final audio output "clips", i.e. exceeds the maximum value.

      • resetClipFlag

        public static void resetClipFlag()
        Resets the value of the clip flag to false. The clip flag is set to true whenever the final audio output "clips", i.e. exceeds the maximum value.

      • setVolumeRampTime

        public static void setVolumeRampTime(float ms)
        Sets the maximum rate at which volumes change on playing sounds, in ms per full volume scale. Default value is 40 ms.

      • getVolumeRampTime

        public static float getVolumeRampTime()
        Gets the maximum rate at which volumes change on playing sounds, in ms per full volume scale.

      • lockAudio

        public static void lockAudio()
        Lock the audio processing thread to prevent it from processing any API calls. The lock should be held only for a short time. This is useful to ensure that certain calls are processed together. For example, if you want to play multiple sounds together exactly in sync, call lockAudio(), call play() on each sound, then call unlockAudio().

      • unlockAudio

        public static void unlockAudio()
        Unlock the audio processing thread after a call to lockAudio().

      • startCapture

        public static void startCapture(java.lang.String path,
                                PathType pathType)
        Start capturing the final audio output to a file. The filename must end with ".wav" (for a Microsoft WAVE file) or ".raw" (for a headerless file containing 32-bit floating-point interleaved stereo samples).

      • stopCapture

        public static void stopCapture()
        Stop capturing audio output.
